Sloan Digital Sky Survey
Sloan Digital Sky Survey

• Digital map in 5 spectral bands covering ¼ of the sky. • Will obtain 40 TB of raw pixel data. • Photometric catalog with more than 200 million objects. • Spectra of 1 million objects. • Data Release One – DR1: 6 TB of images, 200 k spectra.

The SkyServer Database
The SkyServer Database

• Processed data is stored into a relational database, SkyServer. • Allows fast exploration and analysis of the data (Data Mining). • DR1 data base (Best + Target): ~ 1TB and 6TB for final
• Processed data is stored into a relational database, SkyServer. • P r o c e s s e d

Partitioning Facts
Partitioning Facts

• Partitioning works well if tables in the database are
• Partitioning works well if tables in the database are • P a r t i t i o n i n g
w o r k s
w e l l
i f
t a b l e s
i n
t h e
d a t a b a s e
a r e

naturally divisible into similar partitions where most of the rows accessed by any SQL statement can be placed on the same member server.

• Partitioning is most effective if the tables in the database can be partitioned symmetrically. (Not exactly our case)

Partitioning Strategy
Partitioning Strategy

• Two-Step Process
• Two-Step Process • T w o - S t e p
P r o c e s s

1. Distribute data homogenously among servers.
1. Distribute data homogenously among servers.

- Each server has roughly the same amount of objects. - Objects inside servers are spatially related. - Balances the workload among servers. - Queries redirected to the server holding the data. (Re)Define zones inside each server dynamically. - Zones are defined according to some search radius
- Each server has roughly the same amount of objects.
- Objects inside servers are spatially related.
- Balances the workload among servers.
- Queries redirected to the server holding the data.
(Re)Define zones inside each server dynamically.
- Zones are defined according to some search radius

to solve specific problems: - Finding Galaxy Cluster, - Gravitational Lenses, etc.
to solve specific problems:
- Finding Galaxy Cluster,
- Gravitational Lenses, etc.

- Facilitates cross-match queries from other NVO data
- Facilitates cross-match queries from other NVO data

Mapping the Sphere into Zones
Mapping the Sphere into Zones

• Each Zone is a declination stripe of height h. • In principle, h can be any number. In practice, 30 arcsec.
• Each Zone is a declination stripe of height h. • E a c h
